reviews.text:
This place is always the hidden jem for those who know.

We followed the lights and found another sparkly paradise... so we decided to order a little bit of everything and everything taste good... will return to try a little of everything again.

I must say one of the best value places Iâ€™ve gone to. Food quality is also outstanding especially the western food and the soup.

Came at lunch time to try the herbal soup and ended up getting the fried horfun. But what luck! The fried horfun was sooo good - amazing flavours and texture with a lingering wok hei with every bite. It was good to the very last bite. At $5.50, the portion was good for two if you're not a big eater. So satisfying that I'm definitely coming back for more.
Kaki Corner/Western Food and chap cai is best. The rest are just normal.
Windy and spacious coffee shop. Many options available. Cai fan, China food, roast meat, noodles, double boiled soup, Zi char, Indian food, western food, dessert stall.

Was recommended the soup at this coffeeshop which is probably only known to residents and those working in the nearby industrial area. Clean and well-ventilated with a good selection of food. The soup was good and quite similar to Ah Er. Also tried the China food stall which offers a spread of ready to eat dishes and cook to order food. Filled with beer drinkers at night. Staff are quick to clean tables.
